content: In 2008 I graduated from Ryerson University with a degree in New Media. The program focused on concepts connected with emerging technologies and practical training in HTML/CSS, as well as circuit building, and media software After Effects, Final Cut Pro, and others.
My final New Media project was a trucking themed game styled after early graphical adventure games. The project was featured in Ryerson's Nuit Blanche showcase of 2007.

My first role in the tech industry was with Webkinz (a division of Ganz Studios) in 2008, at the time a leader in the world of online family entertainment, which gave me an invaluable foundation for working in tech: Participating in Scrums; using a version controlled repository; coordinating with multiple departments (Creative writers, devs, QA, and artists) to produce interactive content; adhering to strict specifications when delivering assets. At the time, I was coding in ActionScript, the programming language of Flash.
caption: My UI design of a Webkinz Jr. Online activity, as seen in The New York Times, May 2009.

content: My next full time role was with ELL Technologies, an english language-learning software producer, which provided the chance to contribute in the world of education design.

At fast-paced marketing agency Inter-Web, I took a central role in designing, prototyping and writing spec documents for several eCommerce websites. I created art concepts and coded landing pages and e-newsletters. It was largely the positive experiences coding for web which led me to embark on a career based on working with front-end technology.
caption: During my time at a marketing agency, I re-designed e-commerce websites, including Canadian Insulin, shown here.

content: In my spare time, I enjoy digging up facts and personal accounts about the history of computer technology, software and games. I'm an avid reader, and I play badminton and tennis.
I volunteer with an organization called Destination Imagination, which facilitates extracurricular creative and engineering challenges for children and high-school students.

Three month diploma program intensive in Front End technologies, including React, SASS, command line Git, accessibility, OAuth, MySQL, as well as server side JavaScript, Model-view-controller software design pattern, and computer networking fundamentals.

Training in the Principles and history of Design, circuit building, HTML/CSS, and  multimedia software including After Effects, Final Cut Pro, and PhotoShop. Additionally, concepts and theories relating to emerging technology, culture, and art.
